info.description: The ESG API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts JSON-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, and verbs.
info.title: ESG API

post.description:
Each requests requires a valid o-username, o-password, gp-name, gp-key and JSON Object (body):
  • o-username refers to the Okta username. The Okta username and password ensure authentication of the ESG platform when logging in. To create an Okta with username and password please send us the email you intend to use for the account setup. This must be a company email address (not company email attributed to a person). After you provide us with the email address, you will receive an email with the next step to create a username and password. This are the username and password you have to use in the header.
  • o-password refers to the Okta password. Please refer to the process outlined under O-username to create your Okta password.
  • gp-name refers to the name of the general partner (GP) on whose behalf you are submitting. For initial development, you will receive a dummy GP name from us. For go-live, you will be required to request this from the GP on whose behalf you are submitting.
  • gp-key refers to the name of the general partner (GP) on whose behalf you are submitting. For initial development, you will receive a dummy GP key from us. For go-live, you will be required to request this from the GP on whose behalf you are submitting.
Note on required fields in the JSON Object
  • companyID refers to the companyID refers to the ID of portfolio company for whom the ESG metrics are being submitted.
  • fundID refers to the ID of the fund holding the portfolio company.
  • year refers to the year for which the respective ESG metrics are being reported.
companyID, year and fundID are a unique combination and a mandatory fields.

Validation checks

Further, there are validation constraints that must be satisfied for a successful data submission. These validation constraints check for correct data type, but also check for logical errors (e.g. boardMembers > boardWomen). Pleaser refers to models.Data for details on the validations constraints.
post.summary: This endpoint allows for an ESG platform to submit data on behalf of a fund’s general partner (GP).

companyID.description:
Unique identifier for portfolio company that should be anonymized by the GP. Where relevant, this should be held consistent across data submissions for different years of the initiative:

 1. companyID, year, and fundID must be a unique combination 
 2. Checks if there is a unique identifier for each portfolio company 
 3. Checks consistency across data submissions for different years of the initiative.

companyName.description:
Name of portfolio company: 

 1. Check if Company ID and Company Name are unique identifiers (a PortCo cannot have more than one company ID). 
 2. Check if company ID is consistent for a given Company Name across multiple data records.

fundID.description:
Unique identifier for fund that portfolio company is a part of that should be anonymized by the GP. Where relevant, this should be held consistent across data submissions for different years of the initiative: 

 1. companyID, year, and fundID must be a unique combination 
 2. Checks if there is a unique identifier for each fund name 
 3. Checks consistency across data submissions for different years of the initiative.

year.description:
reporting year:

 1. A four-digit integer string (e.g., 2024) 
 2. companyID, year, and fundID must be a unique combination 
 3. Reporting year can be any year between 2019 (inclusive) and 2024.

sanctionedOperations.description:
To ensure compliance with sanctions relating to the provision of benchmark services, please indicate if any data relates to operations in and/or revenue from: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Russia, Belarus, Syria, Crimea, Donetsk or Luhansk regions of Ukraine. Must be one of: 
* A. No - this company has no operations in, or revenue from, sanctioned countries 
* B. No - any data related to operations in, or revenue from, sanctioned countries has been removed 
* C. Yes - there is data that relates to operations in, or revenue from, sanctioned countries

fundName.description:
Name of the fund:

 1. Check if Fund ID and Fund Name are unique identifiers (a Fund cannot have more than one Fund ID) 
 2. Check if fund ID is consistent for a given fund Name across multiple data records.

fundType.description:
Type of fund. Must be one of: 
* Private Equity 
* Infrastructure 
* Private Credit

fundClassification.description:
If the fund is classified under SFDR as Article 6, Article 8, or Article 9 (if relevant). Must be one of: 
* Article 6 
* Article 8 
* Article 9 
* N/A

initialInvestmentYear.description:
Year the first investment by the GP into the relevant portfolio company was made: 
 1. A four-digit integer string (e.g., 2022) 
 2. Year of initial investment cannot be a year in the future

coInvestedWithGPs.description:
Indicate whether you are co-invested in this company with one or more GPs. 

 1. Applies to 'Private Equity' or 'Infrastructure' fundType only 
 2. value must be 'Y' or 'N'

pcSponsorOwnership.description:
Indicate if this company is owned by one or more Private Equity GPs. 

 1. Applies to 'Private Credit' fundType only. 
 2. value must be 'Y' or 'N'

relevantGPs.description: List of string of relevant GPs co-invested in this portfolio company or GP sponsors for Private Credit sponsor-backed investments.

percentGPOwnership.description:
Total holdings that you as a GP control through equity, between 0-100%. Note that percent GP ownership should include co-investment share with effective GP control. 

 1. Applies to 'Private Equity' or 'Infrastructure' fundType only 
 2. value must be between zero and one

percentFundOwnership.description:
Total holdings that you as a GP control through equity via that specific fund, between 0-100%. In the majority of cases, this will be same as Percent GP ownership. 

 1. Applies only to 'Private Equity' or 'Infrastructure' fundType value only 
 2. should be numeric value between zero and one 
 3. Fund ownership should be less than or equal to GP ownership 
 4. Sum of ownership across funds for a PortCo in a given year should not exceed the GP ownership for that PortCo in a given year. 
 5. Sum of ownership across funds for a PortCo in a given year should not exceed 1.

loanPrincipal.description:
Principal amount of the loan lent to the company. 

 1. Applies to 'Private Credit' fundType value only 
 2. should be a non-negative numeric value.

countryOfDomicile.description: Country where company affairs are discharged. Must be one of: abkhazia, afghanistan, åland, albania, algeria, american samoa, andorra, angola, anguilla, antigua and barbuda, argentina, armenia, artsakh, aruba, australia, austria, azerbaijan, growthStage.description:
Description of company growth stage. This is based on self- determination. Note, this is not a description of the investment strategy. Must be one of: Buyout, Growth, Venture - Seed, Venture - Series A, Venture - Series B, Venture - Series C, Infra - In development, Infra - Operational.
* For Private Equity, only one of the below applies:
  * Buyout
  * Growth
  * Venture - Seed
  * Venture - Series A
  * Venture - Series B
  * Venture - Series C
* For Infrastructure, only one of the below applies:
  * In development
  * Operational
* For Private Credit, only one of the below applies:
  * Buyout
  * Growth
  * Venture - Seed
  * Venture - Series A
  * Venture - Series B
  * Venture - Series C

primarySector.description:
Sector according to SASB Sustainable Industry Classification System (SICS). Note that Sector is broader than Industry. Must be one of: 
* Consumer Goods 
* Extractives & Minerals Processing 
* Financials 
* Food & Beverage 
* Health Care 
* Infrastructure 
* Renewable Resources & Alternative Energy 
* Resource Transformation 
* Services 
* Technology & Communications 
* Transportation.

primaryIndustry.description:
Industry according to SASB Sustainable Industry Classification System (SICS). Note that Industry is nested under Sector. Must be one of:

* Consumer Goods:
  * Apparel, Accessories & Footwear
  * Appliance Manufacturing
  * Building Products & Furnishings
  * E-Commerce
  * Household & Personal Products

enum: Electronic Manufacturing Services & Original Design Manufacturing

primarySubIndustry.description:
Field to provide extra granularity on SICS industry of operations - using a combination of GICS sub-industries and TICCS industrial classes depending on which is best suited to the chosen industry. Must be one of: 

* Consumer Goods:
  * Apparel, Accessories & Footwear:
    * Apparel, Accessories & Luxury Goods
    * Footwear
    * Textiles
  * Appliance Manufacturing:
    * Consumer Electronics
    * Household Appliances
  * Building Products & Furnishings (no primary subindustry)
  * E-Commerce (no primary subindustry)
  * Household & Personal Products:
    * Home Furnishings
    * Household Products
    * Housewares & Specialties
    * Personal Care Products
  * Multiline and Specialty Retailers & Distributors:
    * Apparel Retail
    * Automotive Retail
    * Broadline Retail
    * Computer & Electronics Retail
    * Distributors
    * Home furnishing Retail
    * Home Improvement Retail
    * Other Specialty Retail
    * Technology Distributors
  * Toys & Sporting Goods (no primary subindustry)


* Extractives & Minerals Processing:
  * Coal Operations (no primary subindustry)
  * Construction Materials (no primary subindustry)
  * Iron & Steel Producers (no primary subindustry)
  * Metals & Mining:
    * Aluminum
    * Copper
    * Diversified Metals & Mining
    * Gold
    * Precious Metals & Minerals
    * Silver
  * Oil & Gas - Exploration & Production:
    * Oil & Gas Drilling
    * Oil & Gas Exploration & Production
  * Oil & Gas - Midstream:
    * Energy Resource Processing Companies
    * Energy Resource Storage Companies
    * Natural Resources Transportation Companies
  * Oil & Gas - Refining & Marketing (no primary subindustry)
  * Oil & Gas - Services:
    * Integrated Oil & Gas
    * Oil & Gas Equipment & Services


* Financials:
  * Asset Management & Custody Activities (no primary subindustry)
  * Commercial Banks:
    * Diversified Banks
    * Regional Banks
  * Consumer Finance (no primary subindustry)
  * Insurance:
    * Insurance Brokers
    * Life & Health Insurance
    * Multi-line Insurance
    * Property & Casualty Insurance
    * Reinsurance
  * Investment Banking & Brokerage (no primary subindustry)
  * Mortgage Finance:
    * Commercial & Residential Mortgage Finance
    * Mortgage REITs
  * Security & Commodity Exchanges (no primary subindustry)


* Food & Beverage:
  * Agricultural Products (no primary subindustry)
  * Alcoholic Beverages:
    * Brewers
    * Distillers & Vintners
  * Food Retailers & Distributors:
    * Consumer Staples Merchandise Retail
    * Food Distributors
    * Food Retail
  * Meat, Poultry & Dairy:

* Health Care:

    * Pharmaceuticals
  * Drug Retailers (no primary subindustry)
  * Health Care Delivery:
    * Health Care Facilities

  * Health Care Distributors (no primary subindustry)
  * Managed Care (no primary subindustry)
  * Medical Equipment & Supplies:
    * Health Care Equipment
    * Health Care Supplies


* Infrastructure:
  * Electric Utilities & Power Generators:
    * District Cooling/Heating Companies
    * Electricity Distribution Companies
    * Electricity Transmission Companies
    * Independent Power Producers
  * Engineering & Construction Services:
    * Construction & Engineering
    * Environmental Management
  * Gas Utilities & Distributors:
    * Gas Distribution Companies
    * Gas Utilities
  * Home Builders (no primary subindustry)
  * Real Estate:
    * Data Center REITs
    * Diversified REITs
    * Health Care REITs
    * Hotel & Resort REITs
    * Industrial REITs
    * Multi-Family Residential REITs
    * Office REITs
    * Other Specialized REITs
    * Retail REITs
    * Self-Storage REITs
    * Single-Family Residential REITs
    * Telecom Tower REITs
    * Timber REITs
  * Real Estate Services:

    * Real Estate Operating Companies
    * Real Estate Services
  * Waste Management:

  * Water Utilities & Services:
    * Independent Water and Power Producers

    * Water Supply and Treatment
  * Other:
    * Smart Metering Companies


* Renewable Resources & Alternative Energy:
  * Biofuels (no primary subindustry)

currency.description: Description of monetary unit using three letter code (ISO 4217 code). Currency must be one of: AFA, ALL, DZD, AOR, ARS, AMD, AWG, AUD, AZN, BSD, BHD, BDT, BBD, BYN, BZD, BMD, BTN, BOB, BWP, BRL, GBP, BND, BGN, BIF, KHR, CAD, CVE, KYD, XOF, XAF, XPF, CLP, CNY, COP, KMF, CDF, CRC, HRK, CUP, CZK, DKK, DJF, DOP, XCD, EGP, SVC, ERN, EEK, ETB, EUR, FKP, FJD, GMD, GEL, GHS, GIP, XAU, XFO, GTQ, GNF, GYD, HTG, HNL, HKD, HUF, ISK, XDR, INR, IDR, IRR, IQD, ILS, JMD, JPY, JOD, KZT, KES, KWD, KGS, LAK, LVL, LBP, LSL, LRD, LYD, LTL, MOP, MKD, MGA, MWK, MYR, MVR, MRO, MUR, MXN, MDL, MNT, MAD, MZN, MMK, NAD, NPR, ANG, NZD, NIO, NGN, KPW, NOK, OMR, PKR, XPD, PAB, PGK, PYG, PEN, PHP, XPT, PLN, QAR, RON, RUB, RWF, SHP, WST, STD, SAR, RSD, SCR, SLL, XAG, SGD, SBD, SOS, ZAR, KRW, LKR, SDG, SRD, SZL, SEK, CHF, SYP, TWD, TJS, TZS, THB, TOP, TTD, TND, TRY, TMT, AED, UGX, XFU, UAH, UYU, USD, UZS, VUV, VEF, VND, YER, ZMK, ZWL.

revenue.description: Annual gross revenue reported at the end of the calendar year (corresponding to 'Currency' column). Please indicate if different definition of revenue used due to industry-specific standard.

currentYearFTEs.description: Number of Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) employees at the end of the calendar year for which data is being provided.

averageCurrentYearFTEs.description: Average number of Full Time Equivalent (FTE) employees in the calendar year for which data is being provided.

previousYearFTEs.description: Number of Full Time Equivalent (FTE) employees at the end of the calendar year prior to the year for which data is being provided.

averagePreviousYearFTEs.description: Average number of Full Time Equivalent (FTE) employees in the calendar year prior to the year for which data is being provided.

scope1GHGEmissions.description: Direct emissions (measured in metric tons CO2e) due to owned, controlled sources accounted for using GHG Protocol. GPs should submit data relating to the entire portfolio company and make no adjustments for equity or ownership stake.

scope1Methodology.description:
Choice of predominant methodology used to determine emissions. Must be one of:
* Activity-based
* Direct Monitoring
* Spend-based
* Other 
###

scope2GHGEmissions.description: Indirect emissions (measured in metric tons CO2e) due to purchase of electricity, heat, steam, etc. accounted for using GHG Protocol. GPs should submit data relating to the entire portfolio company and make no adjustments for equity or ownership stake.

scope2Methodology.description:
Choice of predominant methodology used to determine emissions. Must be one of:
* Location-based
* Market-based
* Other

scope3GHGEmissions.description: All other indirect emissions (measured in metric tons CO2e) accounted for using GHG Protocol. GPs should submit data relating to the entire portfolio company and make no adjustments for equity or ownership stake.

scope3Methodology.description:
Choice of predominant methodology used to determine emissions. Must be one of: 
* Activity-based
* Direct Emissions/Supplier-based
* Spend-based
* Other

scope3EmissionCategories.description: Array of 15 boolean values representing categories in Scope 3 GHG emissions data. Each boolean indicates whether a specific category is captured in emissions reporting.

isRepresentativeTotalScope3.description:
Do you think this is representative of the total Scope 3 Emissions? Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

emissionComments.description: Description of relevant methodology and any comments that may be relevant

externalReviewComments.description: Commentary on whether emissions data has been reviewed by an external 3rd party. Review of GHG emissions inventory by an independent firm to assess your organization’s emissions data collection and reporting.

decarbonizationPlan.description:
Does the PortCo have a time-bound action plan that clearly outlines how an organization will pivot its existing assets, operations, & entire business model towards a trajectory that aligns with the latest & most ambitious climate science recommendations. 

Does this PortCo have a decarbonization strategy/plan in place? Must be one of:

* A. No
* B. Yes, but without board oversight
* C. Yes, with board oversight

emissionReductionTarget.description:
If the portfolio company is Paris-aligned, they are aligned with net zero by 2050 with contributions to limit global warming to no more than 1.5 degrees Celsius, in line with the latest climate science and higher end ambition of the Paris agreement.

 Does the Portfolio Company have a short-term (I.e., 5- to 10-years) GHG emission reduction target in place?
* A. No
* B. Yes, but it is not Paris-aligned
* C. Yes, and it is Paris–aligned (covering  Scope 1, 2, & material Scope 3*)

netZeroGoal.description:
Assess if the PortCo is aligned with Paris aligned net zero commitment of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees by 2050 or if the PortCo plans to align in the future. 

 Does the Portfolio Company have a long-term net zero goal?
* A. No - and no plan to set one (e.g. lack of viable pathway)
* B. No - but we plan to establish this in the near term (<2 years)
* C. No - we have a long-term goal but not fully aligned with a net zero pathway (i.e., NZ emissions by 2050 or sooner)
* D. Yes - aligned with a net zero pathway (i.e., NZ emissions by 2050 or sooner)

totalEnergyConsumption.description:
Total energy directly consumed by the entity during the reporting period.

 
 1. totalEnergyConsumption should be a non-negative numeric value. Null value if unknown. 
 2. The unit of totalEnergyConsumption is kilowatt-hours (kWh) 
 3. totalEnergyConsumption cannot be less than renewableEnergyConsumption.

renewableEnergyConsumption.description:
Total renewable energy consumed from geothermal, solar, sustainably sourced biomass (inc. biogas), hydropower and wind energy. Accounting should follow best practices in RE100 and GHG Protocol Scope 2 Guidance.

 
 1. renewableEnergyConsumption should be a non-negative numeric value. Null value if unknown. 
 2. The unit of renewableEnergyConsumption is kilowatt-hours (kWh) 
 3. renewableEnergyConsumption cannot be greater than totalEnergyConsumption.

renewableEnergyMethodology.description:
Choice of methodology used to determine renewable energy consumption. Must be one of: 
* Supplier-based methodology 
* Location average methodology 
* Other

renewableEnergyCommentary.description: Description of methodology used and any comments that may be relevant.

boardMembers.description:
Number of people on the Board at end of Calendar Year (Board defined as the member-elected top governing body of the company and often includes nonexecutive members).

 
 1. Total number of board members should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. It should be greater than/equal to number of women board members and number of board members from under-represented groups.

boardWomen.description:
Number of women on board of directors at end of calendar year:

 1. Number of women on board should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. It should not exceed total number of board members.

boardUnderrepresentedGroups.description:
Number of people self-identified as belonging to an under-represented group (i.e. belonging to an ethnic minority within a given country’s context).

 1. Number of board members from under-represented groups should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. It should not exceed total number of board members.

cSuiteEmployees.description:
Number of people in C-suite positions at end of Calendar Year (CEO and any senior executives or leadership roles reporting directly to the CEO, e.g. CFO, COO, CAO, Head of HR etc. as defined in ILPA’s Diversity Metrics Template):

 1. Total number of C-suite employees should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. It should be greater than or equal to number of women C-suite employees.

cSuiteWomen.description:
Number of women in C-suite positions at end of Calendar Year: 

 1. Number of women in C-suite should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. It should not be greater than total number of C-suite employees.

workInjuries.description:
Total number of work-related injuries, as defined by local jurisdiction. Injury records could come from national systems as part of primary data source: 

 1. Total number of work-related injuries should be a positive integer.

commutingIncidentInclusion.description:
Indicate if reported injuries includes commuting with Y/N. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

workFatalities.description:
Total number of work-related fatalities as defined by local jurisdiction, within the last calendar year. Fatality records could come from national systems as part of primary data source: 

 1. Total number of work-related fatalities should be a positive integer. Null value if unknown. 
 2. Number of work-related fatalities cannot exceed number of work-related injuries.

injuryDays.description:
Total days lost due to work-related injury. Note: “days lost due to injury (temporary incapacity)” excludes the day of the accident, temporary medical absences,“sick days” alotted in advance by the employer, permanent-incapacity injuries and fatalities:

 1. Total days lost due to work-related injury must be a non-negative numeric input. Null value if unknown. 
 2. Number of days lost due to injury cannot exceed (number of work-related injuries * 365) 
 3. If number of work-related injuries are zero then number of days lost due to injury is usually not positive.

netChangeFTEMandA.description: Net change in FTEs due to mergers, acquisitions and divestitures.

organicNetNewHires.description:
New hires (the number of FTE joining the company) less turnover (the number of FTE leaving the company) during 'Year', with any changes due to M&A excluded. Excludes any FTE growth or decline due to a business acquisition or business unit divestiture. 

 1. Ensure that Organic Net New Hires = Current Year FTEs - Previous Year FTEs - (net change in FTEs due to M&A) 
 2. Ensure that Previous Year FTEs + Organic Net New Hires ≥ 0 
 3. Ensure that Organic Net New Hires = Total Net New Hires - (net change in FTEs due to M&A)

totalNetNewHires.description:
New hires (the number of FTE joining the company) less turnover (the number of FTE leaving the company) during 'Year'. Includes any FTE growth or decline due to a business acquisition or business unit divestiture: 

 1. Ensure that Total Net New Hires = Current Year FTEs - Previous Year FTEs 
 2. Ensure that Current Year FTEs - Total Net New Hires ≥ 0

annualTurnoverFTE.description:
Turnover (the number of FTEs leaving the business excluding those from M&A) over the course of 'Year': 

 1. Turnover should be greater than 0. 
 2. Ensure that Organic net new hires ≥ (Turnover * -1)

annualPercentTurnoverFTE.description:
Turnover (the number of FTEs leaving the business excluding those from M&A) over the course of 'Year' divided by the total number of FTEs in the previous year, multiplied by 100: 

 1. Turnover should be greater than 0 and is usually less than 100%. 
 2. Ensure that Organic net new hires/Previous year FTEs > (Turnover * -1) 
 3. Ensure that Turnover % = Turnover (#) / Previous Year FTEs

employeeSurvey.description:
Y/N response indicating whether a company issues an employee feedback survey regularly. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N 

 and 

 1. If you have reported for any of the next 4 metrics, this metric must be Y. 
 2. If you have reported N then the next 4 metrics must be blank.

employeeSurveyResponseRate.description:
Total number of employees responding to survey divided by total number of employees surveyed.

 1. Employee survey response rate must be beween 0 and 100% 
 2. Null value if unknown or if you have reported N for 'do you conduct an employee survey regularly' metric

isEmployeeSatisfactionCollected.description:
Employee satisfaction scores can include eNPS (Employee Net Promoter Score) or ESI (Employee Satisfaction Index) among other calculation methodologies and formulas. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N 

 and 

 1. Null value if unknown or if you have reported N for 'do you conduct an employee survey regularly' metric

employeeSatisfactionScoreMethod.description:
Indicate name of employee satisfaction score type/methodology used, such as eNPS (Employee Net Promoter Score), ESI (Employee Satisfaction Index), etc.:

 1. Null value if unknown or if you have reported N for 'do you conduct an employee survey regularly' metric

employeeSatisfactionScore.description:
Input employee satisfaction score collected. For example: eNPS score should be a %, ESI scores should be a number on the scale of 0 to 100. Others may differ based on score methodology. Please see the appendix in the metrics guidance document for more:

 1. Null value if unknown or if you have reported N for 'do you conduct an employee survey regularly' metric

sfdrReportingCurrency.description: Currency for which all SFDR financial metrics are reported in.

currentInvestment.description: The value of all investments by the fund (should include equity and debt).

enterpriseValue.description: The sum, at fiscal year-end, of the market cap of ordinary shares, the market capitalisation of preferred shares, and the book value of total debt and non-controlling interests, without the deduction of cash or cash equivalents

currentFundInvestment.description: The value of the fund's investment in the company (should include equity and debt).

financedScope1GHGEmissions.description:
Financed Scope 1 GHG emissions (mtCO2e) are allocated to investors based on the value of their investment in a company.

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:
 1. enterpriseValue 
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. scope1GHGEmissions

financedScope2GHGEmissions.description:
Financed Scope 2 GHG emissions (mtCO2e) are allocated to investors based on the value of their investment in a company.

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:
 1. enterpriseValue 
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. scope2GHGEmissions

financedScope3GHGEmissions.description:
Financed Scope 3 GHG emissions (mtCO2e) are allocated to investors based on the value of their investment in a company.

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:
 1. enterpriseValue 
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. scope3GHGEmissions

totalFinancedGHGEmissions.description:
Financed GHG emissions (mtCO2e)are allocated to investors based on the value of their investment in a company.

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:
 1. enterpriseValue 
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. financedScope1GHGEmissions 
 4. financedScope2GHGEmissions 
 5. financedScope3GHGEmissions

fossilFuelsActive.description:
Companies that derive any revenues from exploration, mining, extraction, production, processing, storage, refining or distribution, including transportation, storage and trade, of fossil fuels. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

isPortCoEnergyProducer.description:
Does this PortCo produce any energy that it doesn't consume itself. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

totalEnergyData.description:
Total energy consumption + production (MWh): 

 1. Must be a positive numerical value 
 2. Should be same value as totalEnergyConsumption (EDCI Field)/1000 if isPortCoEnergyProducer is 'N' 
 3. Should be greater than totalEnergyConsumption (EDCI Field)/1000 if isPortCoEnergyProducer is 'Y'

renewableEnergyData.description:
Total renewable energy consumption + production (MWh): 

 1. Must be a positive numerical value 
 2. Should be same value as renewableEnergyConsumption (EDCI Field)/1000 if isPortCoEnergyProducer is 'N' 
 3. Should be greater than renewableEnergyConsumption (EDCI Field)/1000 if isPortCoEnergyProducer is 'Y'

highImpactOps.description:
Any business operations in high impact climate sector? ‘High impact climate sectors’ means NACE sectors A - H, L. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

highImpactEnergyConsumption.description:
Total energy consumption (MWh) in ‘High impact climate sectors’ (NACE sectors A - H, L). 

 If this data is not readily available, companies attribute to a specific NACE sector as a whole:

 1. Must be positive numerical value if highImpactOps is 'Y' 
 2. Null value if highImpactOps is 'N' 
 3.	Should be less than or equal to totalEnergyConsumption (EDCI Field)/1000

highImpactRevenue.description:
Revenue in ‘High impact climate sectors’ (NACE sectors A - H, L). 

 If this data is not readily available, companies attribute to a specific NACE sector as a whole:

 1. Must be positive numerical value if highImpactOps is 'Y' 
 2. Null value if highImpactOps is 'N'

highImpactEnergyConsumptionIntensity.description:
Considers energy consumption of 'High impact climate sectors' (NACE sectors A-H, L) normalized by revenue. (MWh consumed [in NACE Sectors A-H, L] / Million revenue [in NACE Sectors A-H, L]). 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on: 
 1. highImpactOps 
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. currentInvestment 
 4. highImpactEnergyConsumption 
 5. highImpactRevenue

highImpactMethodology.description:
Methodology for Energy consumption intensity per high impact climate sector.
###

negativeBiodiversityActivities.description:
Considers companies negatively affecting biodiversity-sensitive areas, according to EU Taxonomy, NACE. Must be one of:

* Y 
* N

pollutionOfWater.description:
Discharge of solid, liquid or gaseous pollutants or contaminants into a body of water: 

 1. Must be a positive numerical value 
 2. Measured in tonnes

pollutionOfWaterMethodology.description:
Commentary on methodology if estimate or proxy is used. 
###

hazardousWaste.description:
Hazardous waste as defined in Article 3(2) of Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council10:

 1. Must be a positive numerical value 
 2. Measured in tonnes

hazardousWasteMethodology.description:
Commentary on methodology if estimate or proxy is used. 
###

globalCompactViolations.description:
Violations of UN Global Compact principles and Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises. Must be one of: 

* Y 
* N

noGlobalCompactMonitoring.description:
Lack of processes and compliance mechanisms to monitor compliance with UN Global Compact principles and OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises. Must be one of: 

* Y 
* N

genderPayGap.description:
Difference between average male and female pay, if female pay is higher than male pay, a negative % should be reported:

 1. Number in percent

boardGenderDiversity.description:
Average ratio of female board members expressed as a percentage of all board members. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on: 
 1. boardMembers 
 2. boardWomen

weaponsInvolvement.description:
Is Involved in manufacturing or selling of controversial weapons (anti-personnel mines, cluster munitions, chemical weapons and biological weapons)? Must be one of: 

* Y 
* N

carbonFootPrint.description:
Total financed GHG emissions normalized by value of all investments in the fund in (mtCO₂e / Million [currency]). 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. financedScope1GHGEmissions 
 3. financedScope2GHGEmissions 
 4. financedScope3GHGEmissions

gHGIntensityPortfolioWeighted.description:
Total GHG intensity allocated based on portfolio weights (mtCO₂e / Million [currency]). 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on: 
 1. revenue 
 2. currentInvestment  
 3. currentFundInvestment 
 4. scope1GHGEmissions 
 5. scope2GHGEmissions 
 6. scope3GHGEmissions

fossilFuelsPortfolioWeighted.description:
Total value of investment in companies active in fossil fuels divided by value of all investments. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. fossilFuelsActive

nonRenewableEnergyPortfolioWeighted.description:
Share of non-renewable energy usage and production allocated based on portfolio weights. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. renewableEnergyData 
 4. totalEnergyData

negativeBiodiversityActivitiesPortfolioW.description:
Total value of investment in companies negatively affecting biodiversity divided by value of all investments. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. negativeBiodiversityActivities

pollutionOfWaterPortfolioWeighted.description:
Financed pollution of water allocated based on portfolio weights (# tonnes / Million [currency] invested). 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. enterpriseValue 
 4. pollutionOfWater

hazardousWastePortfolioWeighted.description:
Financed hazardous waste generated allocated based on portfolio weights (# tonnes / Million [currency] invested). 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. enterpriseValue 
 4. hazardousWaste

globalCompactViolationsPortfolioWeighted.description:
Total value of investment in companies with violations divided by value of all investments. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. globalCompactViolations

noGlobalCompactMonitoringPortfolioWeight.description:
Total value of investment in companies without policies to monitor compliance divided by value of all investments. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. noGlobalCompactMonitoring

genderPayGapPortfolioWeighted.description:
Difference between average male and female pay allocated based on portfolio weights. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. genderPayGap

boardGenderDiversityPortfolioWeighted.description:
Average ratio of female board members allocated based on portfolio weights. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. boardGenderDiversity

weaponsInvolvementPortfolioWeighted.description:
Total value of investment in companies involved in manufacturing or selling of controversial weapons divided by value of all investments. 

 Auto-calculation: this field can be auto-calculated based on other fields. Please leave as null if you would like this to be auto-calculated. The auto-calculation for this field depends on:  
 1. currentInvestment  
 2. currentFundInvestment 
 3. weaponsInvolvement
